Docs.remarks: This method will attempt to retrieve the connection string information from either app.config, or web.config files. User must supply the connection string using the "AppSettings" section of the configuration. The format of the section is as follows:

.method public static hidebysig class Microsoft.ServiceBus.Messaging.EventHubClient CreateFromConnectionString(string connectionString) cil managed

Docs.param: The connection string to use.
Docs.summary: Creates a new instance of the Event Hubs client using the specified connection string. You can populate the property with the name of the Event Hub.
Docs.remarks: The connection can be obtained either from the Azure portal, or created from a instance.
Docs.exception: Thrown when the format of the parameter connectionString is incorrect.

MemberSignature.Value: public string Path { get; }
.property instance string Path

Docs.summary: Gets the path of the Event Hub.
Docs.value: The path of the Event Hub.

MemberSignature.Value: public int PrefetchCount { get; set; }
.property instance int32 PrefetchCount

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the number of events that any receive operation will actively cache. By default, this value is inherited from if the current instance is created from the factory method. Otherwise, the default value is 10,000.
Docs.value: The number of messages that the message receiver can simultaneously request.
Docs.remarks: Note that setting the count too low will affect the effective performance of the Event Hub receive call.
Docs.exception: Thrown if the value is less than the minimum required value of 10.

MemberSignature.Value: public Nullable<long> PrefetchSizeInBytes { get; set; }
.property instance valuetype System.Nullable`1<int64> PrefetchSizeInBytes

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the maximum size (in bytes) in total that any receive operation will actively cache. The size of each event data is determined by the property.
Docs.remarks: The size limit is not an absolute limit, and can go over by as much as (PrefetchSizeInBytes/256kBytes) number of event worth of bytes. Any created from this instance will inherit this value by default. Changes to this value will not be propagated to already created consumer group, but will be used by new created after the change. Also setting this value to non-null value will set to zero. Note that setting the size too low will affect the effective performance of the Event Hub receive call.
Docs.exception: Thrown when the size value is less than the minimum required value of 260K bytes.

MemberSignature.Value: public void SendBatch (System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable<Microsoft.ServiceBus.Messaging.EventData> eventDataList);
.method public hidebysig instance void SendBatch(class System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable`1<class Microsoft.ServiceBus.Messaging.EventData> eventDataList) cil managed

Docs.param: An IEnumerable object containing event data instances.
Docs.summary: Sends a batch of event data.
Docs.remarks: User should make sure the total serialized size of should be under the size limit of one event data transmission, which is 256k by default. Also note that there will be some overhead to form the batch.
Docs.exception: Thrown if the total serialized size of exceeds the allowed size limit for one event transmission (256k by default).

MemberSignature.Value: public System.Threading.Tasks.Task SendBatchAsync (System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable<Microsoft.ServiceBus.Messaging.EventData> eventDataList);

.method public hidebysig instance class System.Threading.Tasks.Task SendBatchAsync(class System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable`1<class Microsoft.ServiceBus.Messaging.EventData> eventDataList) cil managed

Docs.param: An IEnumerable object containing event data instances.
Docs.summary: Asynchronously sends a batch of event data.
Docs.remarks: User should make sure the total serialized size of should be under the size limit of one event data transmission, which is 256k by default. Also note that there will be some overhead to form the batch.
Docs.exception: Thrown if the total serialized size of exceeds the allowed size limit for one event transmission (256k by default).
